item.title: Common Ground
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Several ranching and farming communities living against the stunning landscape of the Rocky Mountain Front in Montana are faced with the decision of what is to become of this unprotected public land. As the community battles with the idea of proposing more wilderness areas, heritage and tradition are seemingly defended on both sides. When the […]
item.content:encoded:
Several ranching and farming communities living against the stunning landscape of the Rocky Mountain Front in Montana are faced with the decision of what is to become of this unprotected public land. As the community battles with the idea of proposing more wilderness areas, heritage and tradition are seemingly defended on both sides. When the people begin to raise their voices, they come to find that what is feared most is change.

A RED REEL film, Common Ground was made possible by The Conservation Alliance and three of it’s members; CLIF Bar, Osprey Packs, and Horny Toad Clothing.

To learn more head to commongrounddoc.com

item.title: #nightslikethese
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: #nightslikethese is a short film directed by my good friend Hannah Macpherson. Currently, it’s making festival rounds. In addition to being the Colorist, I also design all the motion elements that are throughout the piece. Above are some images. Shot on F55 and F3. The F55 shot XAVC 1080p and the F3 used a Gemini […]
item.content:encoded:
#nightslikethese is a short film directed by my good friend Hannah Macpherson. Currently, it’s making festival rounds.

In addition to being the Colorist, I also design all the motion elements that are throughout the piece. Above are some images.

Shot on F55 and F3.

The F55 shot XAVC 1080p and the F3 used a Gemini recorder to get 1080p 4:4:4 DPX image sequences… Which proved to be a data hog.

item.title: Matanza
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Matanza is a short film shot in New Mexico. Currently, it’s making the festival circuit. It won best drama at the 2013 New Mexico Filmmakers Showcase. Corey Weintraub (DP) shot most of the film with filtration, giving it the earth quality you can see above. We also added a layer of grain over the piece – a fine […]
item.content:encoded:
Matanza is a short film shot in New Mexico. Currently, it’s making the festival circuit. It won best drama at the 2013 New Mexico Filmmakers Showcase.

Corey Weintraub (DP) shot most of the film with filtration, giving it the earth quality you can see above. We also added a layer of grain over the piece – a fine 35mm grain on the day scenes, and a gritty 16mm grain over the night scenes.
